awd_titl_txt: I-Corps Sites: Type I - An Innovation Corps Site at UMass Amherst
awd_abstract_narration:
This NSF I-Corps Site at the University of Massachusetts Amherst engages STEM faculty and students in a robust training program in early-stage technology commercialization and entrepreneurship. Innovation Corps (I-Corps) Sites are NSF-funded entities established at universities whose purpose is to nurture and support multiple, local teams to transition their technology concepts into the marketplace. Sites provide infrastructure, advice, resources, networking opportunities, training and modest funding to enable groups to transition their work into the marketplace or into becoming I-Corps Team applicants. I-Corps Sites also strengthen innovation locally and regionally and contribute to the National Innovation Network of mentors, researchers, entrepreneurs and investors.

The NSF I-Corps Site at the University of Massachusetts Amherst introduces the Lean Launchpad methodology and facilitates customer discovery experiences in accord with the NSF's Innovation Corps program while connecting participants to industry and venture development resources. Diversity and inclusion considerations are integrated into both recruitment and curriculum, with the goal of broadening and nurturing the participation of females and underrepresented minorities in STEM entrepreneurship. The Site's goals are to increase campus startups and other innovation outcomes, improve and enrich the existing campus innovation infrastructure, and provide economic development and jobs to the cities and rural areas of Western Massachusetts.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: c/o Office of Grants and Contract Administration

por.por_cntn:
The I-Corps site award, spanning 2018 to January 2025 accomplished many of the intellectual merit and broader impacts sought in the original solicitation. In particular, I-Corps site program helped 84 UMass teams (213 individuals) to become more competitive in the global workforce, improve their STEM education and contribute to societal well being. This was accomplished through three main offerings over the six years: a one-hour orientation to innovation and entrepreneurship called “Warm-Up”, a 3-week long short course called “Jump Start” and follow-on support for additional customer discovery called “Rev-Up.”


The campus innovation and entrepreneurship culture was stimulated as undergraduates, graduate students, post-docs, faculty and staff all learned more about entrepreneurship, customer discovery and lean start-up concepts. The teams were also more prepared for the national course after participating in the UMass regional course. Providing customer discovery and lean startup training for faculty and students also helped them to better understand how to translate their research into solutions to real-world challenges. This, in turn, stimulated and enabled the development of research-driven startups and ultimately SBIR proposals based on UMass Amherst research. 


In the final quarter of the six-year award UMass was able to celebrate the impact of the I-Corps program through the creation of videos highlighting the successes of four innovator teams and the role that the I-Corps program played in their journey. UMass also designed and implemented a day-long showcase event on January 9th, 2025 featuring: innovator team lightning talks, a fireside chat focusing on the importance of of innovation and entrepreneurship in the UMass campus community, a poster session for previous I-Corps participants to showcase their products and customer discovery learnings, and a presentation of the findings from the research conducted during the award period.


Last Modified: 04/18/2025
Modified by: Sundar Krishnamurty
